Description: Fragment of oval handle from neck join to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine buff. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 131 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Nikasagoras. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0173.19.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (194)
